acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96 hours LC50=2.0microg/L of the fish (Carp) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2004).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >5,000mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1979)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification cannot be determined, though the available rat inhalation study reported the LC50 value of >1.83mg/L (4 hours) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1987)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of >5,000mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1979)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no treatment-related increase in tumor incidence observed in rat and mouse carcinogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1979)). Also due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category A4 by ACGIH (2006).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 1 and there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), and since there wasbio-accumulation (log Kow=5.2 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available (melting point: 140-145degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)).

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in in vitro chromosome aberration tests, in vitro gene mutation tests in bacteria and yeast, mouse in vivo micronucleus tests, in vivo chromosome aberration tests and in vivo dominant lethal tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1979, 2004, 2005)).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine or chlorine

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Considered non-pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures since the substance is stable to heat (up to 280degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproduction or offspring development observed in rat 3-generation reproduction studies and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1979, 1987)).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Stable to heat (up to 280degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on eye irritation tests in mammals (species unknown) (HSDB (2006)): "Severely irritating."

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on skin irritation tests in mammals (species unknown) (HSDB (2006)): "Irritating" (though exposure duration and severity of the effects are not presented).

skin_sensitizer.rationale: No skin sensitizing potential was found in guinea pig sensitization tests employing the Maximization method (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2004)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Stable to water (water solubility: 15.78*10^(-6)g/L (20degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data))

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
Causes damage to organs (respiratory system, kidney)
May cause damage to organs (liver, testis)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies: "Inhalation exposure produced necrosis of bronchiolar epithelium, lung congestion and edema, and lesions in renal tubule epithelium" (JMPR (1992)), "massive fatty changes in the liver, reduced spermatogenesis" (JMPR (1977)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.
